Aminocaproic Acid.Definition: An antifibrinolytic agent that acts by inhibiting plasminogen activators which have fibrinolytic properties. (PubChem) Pharmacology: Aminocaproic acid works as an antifibrinolytic. It is a derivative of the amino acid lysine. The fibrinolysis-inhibitory effects of aminocaproic acid appear to be exerted principally via inhibition of plasminogen activators and to a lesser degree through antiplasmin activity. Mechanism of action: Aminocaproic acid binds reversibly to the kringle domain of plasminogen and blocks the binding of plasminogen to fibrin and its activation to plasmin. Drug type: Approved. Investigational. Small Molecule. Drug category: Antifibrinolytic Agents
